info.headline: Extreme Heat Warning issued June 20 at 2:30AM CDT until June 22 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 99 expected. For the Extreme Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up 105 to 110 likely. Low temperatures Friday night and Saturday night will remain in the mid 70s to lower 80s, providing little relief from the heat.
* WHERE...Freeborn County.
* WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, from 2 PM this afternoon to noon CDT Saturday. For the Extreme Heat Warning, from noon Saturday to 9 PM CDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Heat-related illnesses increase significantly during extreme heat and high humidity events. Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses.
info.instruction:
Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors.
Do not leave young children and pets in unattended vehicles. Car interiors will reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
Take extra precautions when outside. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing. Try to limit strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Take action when you see symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke.

parameter.value: HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON CDT SATURDAY... ...EXTREME HEAT WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON SATURDAY TO 9 PM CDT SUNDAY
